title: Direction of velocity launched from turntable

content.question: A compressed spring mounted on a disk can project a small ball. When the disk is not rotating, as shown in the top view above, the ball moves radially outward. The disk then rotates in a counterclockwise direction as seen from above, and the ball is projected outward at the instant the disk is in the position shown above. Which of the following best shows the subsequent path of the ball relative to the ground?

choices.label: Answer choice A shows a circle representing the top view of a disk with a curved arrow indicating counterclockwise rotation. To the right of the center at the edge of the disk, a small spring is shown with its length along the horizontal radius of the circle. A curved arrow pointing to the right and down indicates the trajectory of the ball.

Answer choice B shows a circle representing the top view of a disk with a curved arrow indicating counterclockwise rotation. To the right of the center at the edge of the disk, a small spring is shown with its length along the horizontal radius of the circle. A curved arrow pointing to the right and up indicates the trajectory of the ball.

Answer choice C shows a circle representing the top view of a disk with a curved arrow indicating counterclockwise rotation. To the right of the center at the edge of the disk, a small spring is shown with its length along the horizontal radius of the circle. An arrow pointing to the right indicates the trajectory of the ball.

Answer choice D shows a circle representing the top view of a disk with a curved arrow indicating counterclockwise rotation. To the right of the center at the edge of thedisk, a small spring is shown with its length along the horizontal radius of the circle. A straight arrow pointing to the right and down indicates the trajectory of the ball.

Answer choice E shows a circle representing the top view of a disk with a curved arrow indicating counterclockwise rotation. To the right of the center at the edge of the disk, a small spring is shown with its length along the horizontal radius of the circle. A straight arrow pointing to the right and up indicates the trajectory of the ball.

content.answer: Answer choice E shows a circle representing the top view of a disk with a curved arrow indicating counterclockwise rotation. To the right of the center at the edge of the disk, a small spring is shown with its length along the horizontal radius of the circle. A straight arrow pointing to the right and up indicates the trajectory of the ball.
